properties.displayName: Audit virtual machines without disaster recovery configured
properties.description: Audit virtual machines which do not have disaster recovery configured. To learn more about disaster recovery, visit https://aka.ms/asr-doc.

properties.displayName: Audit VMs that do not use managed disks
properties.description: This policy audits VMs that do not use managed disks

properties.displayName: Virtual machines should be migrated to new Azure Resource Manager resources
properties.description: Use new Azure Resource Manager for your virtual machines to provide security enhancements such as: stronger access control (RBAC), better auditing, Azure Resource Manager based deployment and governance, access to managed identities, access to key vault for secrets, Azure AD-based authentication and support for tags and resource groups for easier security management

metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match

properties.displayName: Deploy default Microsoft IaaSAntimalware extension for Windows Server
properties.description: This policy deploys a Microsoft IaaSAntimalware extension with a default configuration when a VM is not configured with the antimalware extension.

metadata.description: Semicolon delimited list of file paths or locations to exclude from scanning
Semicolon delimited list of file extensions to exclude from scanning
Semicolon delimited list of process names to exclude from scanning
Indicates whether or not real time protection is enabled (default is true)
Indicates whether or not custom scheduled scan settings are enabled (default is false)
Indicates whether scheduled scan setting type is set to Quick or Full (default is Quick)
Day of the week for scheduled scan (1-Sunday, 2-Monday, ..., 7-Saturday)
When to perform the scheduled scan, measured in minutes from midnight (0-1440). For example: 0 = 12AM, 60 = 1AM, 120 = 2AM.

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Unattached disks should be encrypted
properties.description: This policy audits any unattached disk without encryption enabled.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Deploy default Log Analytics Extension for Ubuntu VMs
properties.description: This policy deploys the Log Analytics Extension on Ubuntu VMs, and connects to the selected Log Analytics workspace

metadata.description: Select Log Analytics workspace from dropdown list. If this workspace is outside of the scope of the assignment you must manually grant 'Log Analytics Contributor' permissions (or similar) to the policy assignment's principal ID.

properties.displayName: Require automatic OS image patching on Virtual Machine Scale Sets
properties.description: This policy enforces enabling automatic OS image patching on Virtual Machine Scale Sets to always keep Virtual Machines secure by safely applying latest security patches every month.

properties.displayName: Configure disk access resources with private endpoints
properties.description: Private endpoints connect your virtual networks to Azure services without a public IP address at the source or destination. By mapping private endpoints to disk access resources, you can reduce data leakage risks. Learn more about private links at: https://aka.ms/disksprivatelinksdoc.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy
All disk access resources in this region are validated and private endpoints are created in this region.
A subnet with private endpoint network policies disabled.

properties.displayName: OS and data disks should be encrypted with a customer-managed key
properties.description: Use customer-managed keys to manage the encryption at rest of the contents of your managed disks. By default, the data is encrypted at rest with platform-managed keys, but customer-managed keys are commonly required to meet regulatory compliance standards. Customer-managed keys enable the data to be encrypted with an Azure Key Vault key created and owned by you. You have full control and responsibility for the key lifecycle, including rotation and management. Learn more at https://aka.ms/disks-cmk.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: [Deprecated]: Resource logs in Virtual Machine Scale Sets should be enabled
properties.description: This policy definition is no longer the recommended way to achieve its intent. Instead of continuing to use this policy, we recommend you assign this replacement policy with policy ID a3a6ea0c-e018-4933-9ef0-5aaa1501449b. Learn more about policy definition deprecation at aka.ms/policydefdeprecation

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy
Whether to include AKS Clusters to resource logs extension - True or False

properties.displayName: Managed disks should disable public network access
properties.description: Disabling public network access improves security by ensuring that a managed disk isn't exposed on the public internet. Creating private endpoints can limit exposure of managed disks. Learn more at: https://aka.ms/disksprivatelinksdoc.

metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match

properties.displayName: Configure managed disks to disable public network access
properties.description: Disable public network access for your managed disk resource so that it's not accessible over the public internet. This can reduce data leakage risks. Learn more at: https://aka.ms/disksprivatelinksdoc.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy
All disks in this region are validated and disk access resource would be associated with them.

metadata.displayName: Resource Id for the DiskAccess in the given location to which the disk resource needs to be linked
metadata.description: Disk access resources enable exporting managed disks securely via private endpoints. Learn more at: https://aka.ms/disksprivatelinksdoc

properties.displayName: Microsoft IaaSAntimalware extension should be deployed on Windows servers
properties.description: This policy audits any Windows server VM without Microsoft IaaSAntimalware extension deployed.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: Configure disaster recovery on virtual machines by enabling replication via Azure Site Recovery
properties.description: Virtual machines without disaster recovery configurations are vulnerable to outages and other disruptions. If the virtual machine does not already have disaster recovery configured, this would initiate the same by enabling replication using preset configurations to facilitate business continuity.  You can optionally include/exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. To learn more about disaster recovery, visit https://aka.ms/asr-doc.

metadata.description: Region in which the source virtual machine is deployed
Region to be used to deploy the virtual machine in case of a disaster
Resource group to be used to create the virtual machine in the target region
The resource group containing the recovery services vault used for disaster recovery configurations
Recovery services vault to be used for disaster recovery configurations
Id of an existing virtual network in the target region or name of the virtual network to be created in target region
Availability zone in the designated target region to be used by virtual machines during disaster
Existing cache storage account ID or prefix for the cache storage account name to be created in source region.
Name of the tag to use for including or excluding VMs in the scope of this policy. This should be used along with the tag value parameter.
Values of the tag to use for including or excluding VMs in the scope of this policy (in case of multiple values, use a comma-separated list). This should be used along with the tag name parameter.

Tag type can be either Inclusion Tag or Exclusion Tag. Inclusion tag type will make sure VMs with tag name and tag value are included in replication, Exclusion tag type will make sure VMs with tag name and tag value are excluded from replication.
Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: Configure disk access resources to use private DNS zones
properties.description: Use private DNS zones to override the DNS resolution for a private endpoint. A private DNS zone links to your virtual network to resolve to a managed disk. Learn more at: https://aka.ms/disksprivatelinksdoc.

metadata.displayName: Private DNS Zone ID for managed disks
metadata.description: The private DNS zone name required for managed disks to resolve a private DNS Zone.
Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: Only approved VM extensions should be installed
properties.description: This policy governs the virtual machine extensions that are not approved.

metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match
The list of approved extension types that can be installed. Example: AzureDiskEncryption

properties.displayName: Microsoft Antimalware for Azure should be configured to automatically update protection signatures
properties.description: This policy audits any Windows virtual machine not configured with automatic update of Microsoft Antimalware protection signatures.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: Managed disks should be double encrypted with both platform-managed and customer-managed keys
properties.description: High security sensitive customers who are concerned of the risk associated with any particular encryption algorithm, implementation, or key being compromised can opt for additional layer of encryption using a different encryption algorithm/mode at the infrastructure layer using platform managed encryption keys. The disk encryption sets are required to use double encryption. Learn more at https://aka.ms/disks-doubleEncryption.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: Allowed virtual machine size SKUs
properties.description: This policy enables you to specify a set of virtual machine size SKUs that your organization can deploy.

metadata.description: The list of size SKUs that can be specified for virtual machines.

properties.displayName: Managed disks should use a specific set of disk encryption sets for the customer-managed key encryption
properties.description: Requiring a specific set of disk encryption sets to be used with managed disks give you control over the keys used for encryption at rest. You are able to select the allowed encrypted sets and all others are rejected when attached to a disk. Learn more at https://aka.ms/disks-cmk.

metadata.description: The list of allowed disk encryption sets for managed disks.
Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: Disk access resources should use private link
properties.description: Azure Private Link lets you connect your virtual network to Azure services without a public IP address at the source or destination. The Private Link platform handles the connectivity between the consumer and services over the Azure backbone network. By mapping private endpoints to diskAccesses, data leakage risks are reduced. Learn more about private links at: https://aka.ms/disksprivatelinksdoc.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy

properties.displayName: Virtual machines and virtual machine scale sets should have encryption at host enabled
properties.description: Use encryption at host to get end-to-end encryption for your virtual machine and virtual machine scale set data. Encryption at host enables encryption at rest for your temporary disk and OS/data disk caches. Temporary and ephemeral OS disks are encrypted with platform-managed keys when encryption at host is enabled. OS/data disk caches are encrypted at rest with either customer-managed or platform-managed key, depending on the encryption type selected on the disk. Learn more at https://aka.ms/vm-hbe.

metadata.description: Enable or disable the execution of the policy
